title: (x) Serif headline face in French Vogue - custom version of Caslon 540 {Jenna A}
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202035428im_/http:/typophile.com/files/VogueParisLaetitiaCasta01_6729.jpg)

The font appeared once in the french Vogue.  
There are some similar fonts, but i can’t find  
one with the same stroke difference and the  
fine details like the angular end of »V« or »A«.

Any ideas?

Thanks,  
t.
author: ttschense

comments.content:
I have been told in the past that Vogue uses a custom version of Calson 540  
I'm not sure if this is a version of that or not but might be worth a try.

Hi Jenna,

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202035428im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Bild1_4849.jpeg)

thanks for your response.  
And yes, there are similar forms and proportions  
to the Caslon 540. Is there fallen a name which  
company made a custom version from it?

thanks, t.
